meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a noun.
meanings.sent1: The nounal words in the sentence describe objects.
meanings.sent2: She used many nounal terms in her essay.
meanings.sent3: The nounal book cover caught my eye with its colorful illustrations.
meanings.sent4: His nounal writing style painted vivid pictures in the reader's mind.
meanings.sent5: The nounal language used by the author made the story come alive.

meanings.definition: In the form of a noun.
meanings.sent1: The nounal words were easy to identify in the sentence.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the concept of nounal phrases.
meanings.sent3: The nounal labels on the jars helped organize the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her nounal necklace added elegance to her outfit.
meanings.sent5: The nounal nouns stood out among the verbs and adjectives.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities of a noun.
meanings.sent1: The nounal characteristics of the language made it easy to learn.
meanings.sent2: His nounal approach to storytelling captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The nounal nature of the tree's branches provided shade in the park.
meanings.sent4: The nounal essence of the painting captured the artist's emotions.
meanings.sent5: The nounal presence of the statue added beauty to the garden.
